poem:
**A Morning's Quiz**

What links a ghost town with a poisoned breath,
an Amazonian dream gone wild,
and a forest's blue-stained death?

These questions line my breakfast table
like delicate birds,
perching lightly until they take wing,
and I marvel at
how easily newsprint
turns to poetry
with just a sip
of morning coffee.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links Pripyat, Wittenoom and Fordlândia? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 Which guide featured illustrations of Charles and Edeltraud Raymond?2 Which bird sings while flying up vertically above its nest?3 Who is the UK’s first billionaire musician?4 Which empire was named after an Arabic word for slave?5 What type of drink is pét-nat?6 What New York store has the slogan “18 miles of books”?7 Members of what would wear a 1% patch?8 Which capital". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
